Description: Chromosome that call lies on
Position that call falls on
identifier: Semicolon-separated list of unique identifiers where available. If this is a dbSNP variant it is encouraged to use the rs number(s).
Comma separated list of alternate non-reference alleles.
Symbolic alternate alleles for imprecise structural variants

Phred-scaled quality score for the assertion made in ALT. i.e. _10log10 prob(call in ALT is wrong). If ALT is Ô.Õ (no variant) then this is _10log10 prob(variant), and if ALT is not Ô.Õ this is _10log10 prob(no variant). If unknown, the missing value should be specified. (Numeric)
PASS if this position has passed all filters, i.e., a call is made at this position. Otherwise, if the site has not passed all filters, a semicolon-separated list of codes for filters that fail.
Read Depth
conditional genotype quality
Variant Allele Fraction

Functional annotations: 'Allele | Annotation | Annotation_Impact | Gene_Name | Gene_ID | Feature_Type | Feature_ID | Transcript_BioType | Rank | HGVS.c | HGVS.p | cDNA.pos / cDNA.length | CDS.pos / CDS.length | AA.pos / AA.length | Distance | ERRORS / WARNINGS / INFO'
Predicted loss of function effects for this variant. Format: 'Gene_Name | Gene_ID | Number_of_transcripts_in_gene | Percent_of_transcripts_affected'
Predicted nonsense mediated decay effects for this variant. Format: 'Gene_Name | Gene_ID | Number_of_transcripts_in_gene | Percent_of_transcripts_affected'
Variation is interrogated in a clinical diagnostic assay
Has other variant with exactly the same set of mapped positions on NCBI refernce assembly.
Has 3D structure - SNP3D table
Is Withdrawn by submitter If one member ss is withdrawn by submitter, then this bit is set.  If all member ss' are withdrawn, then the rs is deleted to SNPHistory
First dbSNP Build for RS
Has SubmitterLinkOut - From SNP->SubSNP->Batch.link_out
Has non-synonymous frameshift A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes all downstream amino acids. FxnClass = 44
In 3' gene region FxnCode = 13
In 5' gene region FxnCode = 15
Has non-synonymous nonsense A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes to STOP codon (TER). FxnClass = 41
Has non-synonymous missense A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes protein peptide. FxnClass = 42
>5% minor allele frequency in each and all populations

RS is a common SNP.  A common SNP is one that has at least one 1000Genomes population with a minor allele of frequency >= 1% and for which 2 or more founders contribute to that minor allele frequency.
dbSNP ID (i.e. rs number)
RS orientation is reversed
Provisional Third Party Annotation(TPA) (currently rs from PHARMGKB who will give phenotype data)
Has Assembly conflict. This is for weight 1 and 2 variant that maps to different chromosomes on different assemblies.
Genotypes available. The variant has individual genotype (in SubInd table).
Is Validated.  This bit is set if the variant has 2+ minor allele count based on frequency or genotype data.
Is Assembly specific. This is set if the variant only maps to one assembly
In acceptor splice site FxnCode = 73
Has reference A coding region variation where one allele in the set is identical to the reference sequence. FxnCode = 8
In 3' UTR Location is in an untranslated region (UTR). FxnCode = 53
In 5' UTR Location is in an untranslated region (UTR). FxnCode = 55

An ordered, comma delimited list of allele frequencies based on TOPMed, starting with the reference allele followed by alternate alleles as ordered in the ALT column. The TOPMed minor allele is the second largest value in the list.
Weight, 00 - unmapped, 1 - weight 1, 2 - weight 2, 3 - weight 3 or more
Microattribution/third-party annotation(TPA:GWAS,PAGE)
Submitted from a locus-specific database
Contig allele not present in variant allele list. The reference sequence allele at the mapped position is not present in the variant allele list, adjusted for orientation.
In donor splice-site FxnCode = 75
Has synonymous A coding region variation where one allele in the set does not change the encoded amino acid. FxnCode = 3
1000 Genome phase 3

An ordered, comma delimited list of allele frequencies based on 1000Genomes, starting with the reference allele followed by alternate alleles as ordered in the ALT column. Where a 1000Genomes alternate allele is not in the dbSNPs alternate allele set, the allele is added to the ALT column. The minor allele is the second largest value in the list, and was previuosly reported in VCF as the GMAF. This is the GMAF reported on the RefSNP and EntrezSNP pages and VariationReporter
Variation Class
Is mutation (journal citation, explicit fact): a low frequency variation that is cited in journal and other reputable sources
1000 Genome phase 1 (incl. June Interim phase 1)
Rs cluster has non-overlapping allele sets. True when rs set has more than 2 alleles from different submissions and these sets share no alleles in common.
Variation Property.  Documentation is at ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/specs/dbSNP_BitField_latest.pdf
Variant Allele Origin: 0 - unspecified, 1 - Germline, 2 - Somatic, 3 - Both
Pairs each of gene symbol:gene id.  The gene symbol and id are delimited by a colon (:) and each pair is delimited by a vertical bar (|)
In Intron FxnCode = 6
>5% minor allele frequency in 1+ populations
Has OMIM/OMIA
Links exist to PubMed Central article
Variant Suspect Reason Codes (may be more than one value added together) 0 - unspecified, 1 - Paralog, 2 - byEST, 4 - oldAlign, 8 - Para_EST, 16 - 1kg_failed, 1024 - other
Chr position reported in dbSNP
Marker is on high density genotyping kit (50K density or greater).  The variant may have phenotype associations present in dbGaP.
Variant is Precious(Clinical,Pubmed Cited)
nsv accessions from dbVar for the variant
the ClinVar Allele ID
Aggregate germline classification for this single variant; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
Sequence Ontology id for variant type
For included variant: ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in SCIDISDBINCL
ClinVar review status of germline classification for the Variation ID
ClinVar review status of oncogenicity classification for the Variation ID
For included Variant : ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in CLNDISDB
Aggregate oncogenicity classification for this single variant; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar

Allele origin. One or more of the following values may be added: 0 - unknown; 1 - germline; 2 - somatic; 4 - inherited; 8 - paternal; 16 - maternal; 32 - de-novo; 64 - biparental; 128 - uniparental; 256 - not-tested; 512 - tested-inconclusive; 1073741824 - other
Oncogenicity classification for a haplotype or genotype that includes this variant. Reported as pairs of VariationID:classification; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
For included variant: ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in ONCDISDBINCL
Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier submitted for oncogenicity classifications, e.g. MedGen:NNNNNN
ClinVar review status of somatic clinical impact for the Variation ID
For included variant: Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier for oncogenicity classifications, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN
comma separated list of molecular consequence in the form of Sequence Ontology ID|molecular_consequence
ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in CLNDISDB
Conflicting oncogenicity classification for this single variant; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
Variant type
Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier submitted for somatic clinial impact classifications, e.g. MedGen:NNNNNN
the variant's clinical sources reported as tag-value pairs of database and variant identifier
allele frequencies from ExAC
ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in ONCDISDB
allele frequencies from GO-ESP
Germline classification for a haplotype or genotype that includes this variant. Reported as pairs of VariationID:classification; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier submitted for germline classifications, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN
For included Variant: Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier for germline classifications, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN
allele frequencies from TGP
Conflicting germline classification for this single variant; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
For included variant: Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier for somatic clinical impact classifications, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN
Top-level (primary assembly, alt, or patch) HGVS expression.
Somatic clinical impact classification for a haplotype or genotype that includes this variant. Reported as pairs of VariationID:classification; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in SCIDISDB
Aggregate somatic clinical impact for this single variant; multiple values are separated by a vertical bar
ANN field is parsed and all MC's are output with the frequency of each MC in (*) next to it. Comma separated for multiple.
ANN field is parsed and all IMPACT predictions are output with the frequencies in (*) next to them. Comma separated for multiple.
ANN field is parsed and all Genes called are output with the frequencies in (*) next to them. Comma separated for multiple.
OMIM data (from omim.org) is formatted using 'OMIM.py' and attached. Gene fields are attached based on the genes in GENE_Details.
